law.catch_line: Use of shackle rods or related cables.

text.section: No operator shall utilize shackle rods or related cables for the production of oil or gas without the permission of the present owner of the land upon which the wells exist or are drilled unless such rods or cables are placed in conduit and buried at least twenty-four (24) inches below the surface of the land between all wellheads and power stations or are attached to power poles with the rods or cables twenty (20) feet above the surface of the land between all wellheads and power stations.
Nothing in this section shall apply to lands classified by the United States Soil Conservation Service as class 5, 6, 7, or 8.

law.history: Created 1984 Ky. Acts ch. 244, sec. 1, effective January 1, 1985.
